intro: Borreria centranthoides var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in desert botany and ecological research.
